byline.contributor: Omar Al-Jawoshy reported from Baghdad, Sewell Chan from London, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo. Reporting was contributed by an employee of The New York Times from Anbar Province, Iraq; Helene Cooper and Eric Schmitt from Washington; Rukmini Callimachi from New York; and Mona Boshnaq from London.
byline.original: By OMAR AL-JAWOSHY, SEWELL CHAN and KAREEM FAHIM

abstract: Iraqi forces gain ground in effort recapture Ramadi from Islamic State militants; face car bombs and heavy fire as they reach edge of central government district.
lead_paragraph: Soldiers began a fierce assault against the Islamic State, and by Tuesday evening had reached the edges of the city center despite heavy resistance.

headline.main: Iraqi Forces Fighting ISIS for Ramadi Push Toward City Center
headline.print_headline: Iraqi Forces, Once Reeling, Push Into Key ISIS-Held City

snippet: Soldiers began a fierce assault against the Islamic State, and by Tuesday evening had reached the edges of the city center despite heavy resistance.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
